titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4227) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend to 2005 the alternative minimum tax relief available in 2003 and 2004 and to index such relief for inflation.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4227) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend to 2005 the alternative minimum tax relief available in 2003 and 2004 and to index such relief for inflation.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-477, by Mr. Linder.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4227 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. A specified amendment is in order.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 172.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 619.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 220 - 201 (Roll no. 142).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4227) to amend the Internal Revenue Code to extend to 2005 the alternative minimum tax relief available in 2003 and 2004 and to index such relief for inflation.
